festival.introText:
Black Deer is on a mission to bring real Americana & Country music to the UK, expressed through a unique festival that creates authentic good times with a family friendly vibe.

This annual festival will feature 60 plus performances across 3 days set within the spectacular natural outdoor location of Eridge Park, one of the UK’s oldest and largest Deer parks, just 50 minutes from London.

The sounds at Black Deer will pull from the worlds of Country, Folk, Bluegrass, and the Blues. Simply, Black Deer is where new and established roots-inspired artists tell their stories be it around the campfire or from one of our many stages. Showing you what Americana & Country truly is, where it came from, and where it’s heading.

Expect also to be transported to the Smokehouses of America’s Deep South. Where cooking homegrown, wholesome food ‘slow & low’ in custom made smokers, is always the order of the day. Craft beers, artisan ales, great coffee and amazing whisky ensures the drink at Black Deer is shown the same level of respect as the food.

Experience the counter-culture of custom-built motorbikes at The Black Deer Bike Meet. Spend time at The Marketplace, where artisan wares and their master makers champion the culture of making. And discover Black Deer’s festival within a festival – one in which kids take centre stage, by being given endless opportunities to explore, whether through music, craft, or the great outdoors.

Join the Black Deer family on this special journey into the world of Americana & Country, and immerse yourself in the community, music, food and storytelling of a culture like no other.

faqs.question: When is Black Deer Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Black Deer Festival takes place on Friday 16th June - Sunday 18th June 2023.

faqs.question: Ticket information for Black Deer Festival
faqs.answer: For the latest ticket information for Black Deer Festival, please visit https://blackdeerfestival.com/information/tickets/.

faqs.question: How do I get to Black Deer Festival?
faqs.answer:
Use postcode TN3 9HS and then pick up the yellow AA signage to the festival.

Stop following Sat Nav once you pick up the yellow AA signage.

 

The nearest railway station is Tunbridge Wells and you can then take a shuttle bus or taxi to the festival.

faqs.question: What does a camping ticket include?
faqs.answer: All camping tickets include access to the arena and campsite. Different campsite tickets will only give you access to the campsite specified on your ticket.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: All accessibility information for Black Deer festival can be found at https://blackdeerfestival.com/information/accessibility/.

faqs.question: Where is Black Deer Festival?
faqs.answer: Black Deer Festival is located at Eridge Park, Kent.

faqs.question: Can I bring my car into the campsite?
faqs.answer:
No, you must park in the carpark. You will not be allowed to sleep in your car.

Towing vehicles can park in the live-ins / fancy camping car park.

faqs.question: Can I bring my car into the campsite?
faqs.answer:
No, you must park in the carpark. You will not be allowed to sleep in your car.

Towing vehicles can park in the live-ins / fancy camping car park.

faqs.question: Can I reserve a camping space?
faqs.answer: No, spaces are given on a first come first served basis.

faqs.question: Can I reserve a camping space?
faqs.answer: No, spaces are given on a first come first served basis.

faqs.question: Campfires and BBQs
faqs.answer:
Customers are not permitted to start campfires, though communal campfires will be onsite. 

 

BBQs are welcome in designated areas only and must be disposed of only in the metal bins provided.

faqs.question: Campfires and BBQs
faqs.answer:
Customers are not permitted to start campfires, though communal campfires will be onsite.

BBQs are welcome in designated areas only and must be disposed of only in the metal bins provided.

faqs.question: Will there be showers?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are showers in the general campsite, premium showers in the fancy campsite, and accessible showers in the accessible campsite.
